text: Enjoyed at the brewpub in St-Jerome a year ago. Pours a cloudy brown-amber colour with a big warm-beige head, nice lasting and full of lacing. Hoppy nose over fruity malts. Tarty mouthfeel with a sharp bitter finish. Mild fruity and grassy flavours. Wow ! What a nice bitter that does not show its low alcohol content. Would of never guessed it !!

On tap at Dieu du Ciel (Zwanze Day 2015). Hazy brown-ish amber with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma is quite earthy and mineral with some English hops, toasted malts, leafy notes and toffee notes. Taste is much more delicate than aroma and that works quite well too. Mineral and caramel forward, but also quite leafy. Mild bitterness as well as light sweetness. Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Mineral finish. Easy drinking and quenching. Pretty good Bitter.

Glass, 4-ounce, draught, during the Mondial de la bière, savoured on June 12 2015; eye: brown with a caramel hue, hazy, ring of beige head, light lacing; nose: malt, English hops, old socks, light spices, fresh; moutn: malt, English hops, old socks, light spices, fresh, light astringency, dry finale in bittering hops with presence of spices, medium body, good carbonation, surprisingly bitter, grainy texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Verre, 4 onces, en fût, lors du Mondial de la bière, savourée le 12 juin 2015; il : brune avec une teinte caramel, trouble, anneau de mousse beige, légère dentelle; nez : malt, houblon anglais, « vieux chaussons », léger épices, frais; bouche : malt, houblon anglais, « vieux chaussons », léger épices, frais, légère astringence, finale sèche en houblon amérisant avec présence dépices, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, curieusement amère, texture granuleuse; en résumé : bien

On tap at the brewpub. Lightly hazy copper brown pour with creamy straw foam. Aroma is nice and hoppy, really nice English hop, peppery, black pepper, leafy golding, light caramel, toasted malt aromas. Taste is bitter, toasty, roasty, very light sweetness. Palate is med bodied, nice body with good carbonation. Tasty stuff.
Pours a nice bright red color. Nose is caramel and hops. Flavor is caramel malts, medium dry, with a nice lively hop flavor. I liked that it wasnt trying to be a IPA. Really enjoyed this one.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel, Montreal. Its an unclear, brown beer with a dense, dark beige head. Caramel, toffee and pine cones in the aroma. Its full-bodied, semi dry and with a soft carbonation. Nice bitterness, although I wouldnt mind a bit more, with some piney flavors and a caramel-malty backdrop. A smooth and quite tasteful beer that didnt really ring my bells. 150612
Nice bitter shared by an english chap. Amber color with off white head. Aroma is lightly nutty with spicy hops and bready biscuit malts. Taste is mild bitter and light sweet. Good.
Kind of a dirty red-brown. Soft foam. Light hop and malt scent. Big body! Good malt and a nice hop balance. A full beer.
Thank you Collin for graciously sharing your bitter. Nice toasty/biscuit malts, grassy hop bite at the end. Highly drinkable, very nice.

Draught @ Dieu Du Ciel, Montréal, QC
Pours hazy amber/brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, biscuit, floral, citrus and orange. Taste is meidum sweet and light to medium bitter with a long biscuit, bitter, orange and hint of popcorn. Taste is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft
Una buona bitter dal colore marroncino paglia scura, sottile schiuma bianca, buon aroma floreale, ottimo amaro.
Tap at brewery. Hazy light brown with one finger head. Medium body with toasty nuts. Moderate hop bitterness. Doesnt really go anywhere.

Elle est rousse et limpide et une mousse collante la recouvre. Le nez est assez intensément houblonné et floral avec des parfums de conifères. Cest plus quagréable. En bouche, cest tout aussi charmant, avec une amertume, courte, mais tout aussi puissante, avec ces élans acidulés. Quel plaisir à boire. (1390-020415)
En cask à lIDG. Cuoleur brune, mousse beige. Arôme de houblon et de pain grillé, un peu de noisette. En bouche, légèrement sucrée, malt, pain, céréales, un peu de houblon. Très bonne.

New England Bucket List Trip #147. Keg at St. Jerome. Pours a slightly hazy red with a large creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of toasted malt, mild tart fruits, floral and herbal hops. The taste is herbal notes, spicy and herbal hops, toffee, toasted malt. Medium bodied, strong lingering spice.

On tap @ Isle de Garde. Slightly hazed dark amber/burnt orange pour with soapy white foam. The nose is a little bit floral and hoppy but is mostly dominated by bread and toasted malt. A subtle roasted quality and some toasted nuts. Sweet malts for the most part on the tongue. A light bitterness of grass and earthy hops. Mildly burnt toast, some bread, and a hint of caramel.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear copper amber with a medium sized tan head. Light toast and some dusty hops on the nose. Toasty malt and earthy hops, grapefruit pith. Long slow bitterness on the finish, lots of quinine.
Couleur ambré avec un col mousseux résistant. Aromes de caramel,fruits tropicaux,résine,noix,herbes. Une excellente bière avec une buvabilité incroyable! A quand en bouteille?

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté directement à la brasserie au coût de 4,75$. Arôme: Légère odeur dagrumes et de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée foncée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes et de caramel avec une pointe de noix. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement houblonné. (Rating #5706)

[Draught at Mondial 2014, Montreal] Pours a murky copper-brown with an average size long-lasting frothy tan head. Good lacing on the glass. Aroma is malty, nutty and hoppy. Flavour tastes like a Brown Ale with lots of hops. Nice bitter finish. Average bodied. Lots of flavour for the low abv, I liked it.

tap att ddc kiosk - mondial 2014, mtl. unclear medium dark red, brown tint, with a very nice creamy light beige head, good retention and strong lacing. spicy, grainy and complex caramel and specialty malts, nice toasts and crackery toasted cereals, nice fruitiness too - red fruits, herbal leafiness, tea, earthy and peppery underlying notes, coffee grinds. average to moderate carbonation, light body - never watery, surprisingly, assertive and never harsh grassy-citrusy-spicy-earthy-peppery finish. very effective bitter - much enjoyed! this one should always be on their menu at ddc brewpub!

A copper brown ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, nice nutty caramel malt with herbaceous hops, pleasant. In mouth, a nice nutty caramel malt with herbaceous hops, light coffee, excellent given this is a light beer. On tap at Mondial 2014.

On tap at the Montréal brewpub. Cloudy copper body with an average off-white foamy head. Well balanced malty aroma with hoppy and brown sugar notes. Its fresh malty/hoppy taste carries grainy notes and ends with a decent bitter/woody finish. Not bad.

Pours dark amber with medium white head. Aromas are roasted malts, caramel and pine. Neodymium carbonation, medium body. Dry finish. Light and refreshing!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark amber-copper color, with a thick tan head, nice light floral citrus, leafy, grassy hoppy, zesty lemon, grapefruit peel nose, with a faint mint leaf, subtle spicy lemongrass, cut grass accent, with a herbal coniferous, piney, cedary note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice fruity yeast, good flowery citrus, leafy, grassy hoppy, zesty, spritzy lemon peel character, with a faint lemongrass, lemon pie, subtle peppercorn, grainy toasted, bready, caramel malt flavours, leading towards a nice zesty, spritzy citrus peel, lingering citrus, leafy, grassy hop bitterness finish.

Drank on tap (20 oz) at the Montreal brewpub on March 8, 2014. Dark red, medium head. Malted barley aroma well, notes of green herbs. Barley taste very hoppy, hints of pine, bitter herbs and conifers. A light red ale would not be good, this one is!

Une ale rousse légère! Un col de mousse qui est incertain. Un nez de houblons. Du citron vert et des notes forestières. Des feuilles de toute sorte. Des malts secs. Un goût allumé. Des notes de thé et du jus de pamplemousse. Un corps de moyenne densité. Une texture crémeuse. Une finale sèche, acidulée et amère. Une savoureuse bombe. Tellement facile à boire. Riche pour ses 3.5%. À boire à grandes lampées. Excellente.
